medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Vaginal spotting noted during the initial prenatal visit at 9 weeks of gestation. Cervical mass observed, which progressively led to excessive bleeding post-biopsy. The human Rho(D) immune globulin was administered due to bleeding. Anti-D antibody titer increased from 1:16 to 1:128 over a month prior to presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of obesity and a stillborn male infant delivered at full-term pregnancy 7 years ago. Previous pregnancy resulted in a healthy daughter 5 years ago.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and maternal aunt had a history of cervical cancer treated with hysterectomy. Mother also smoked and had osteoporosis.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with partner and child, does not work outside the home, has never smoked.
